definition: to play music/to achieve/to present a memorial to the emperor (old)
to perform on a musical instrument
musical ensemble of several instruments (e.g. duet 二重奏 or trio 三重奏)
first decapitate then present your trophy (idiom); act first, report later

sentences.english: A song is played back, the flower curtain.
sentences.chinese: 皆奏一楓曲，次年回首花謝幕。

sentences.english: That person leads the instrument ensemble of the chorus in the church.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的合唱表演是由那個人領奏。

sentences.english: The oboe and cello sat alone , echoing tone for tone.
sentences.chinese: 雙簧管和大提琴雙重奏，音調此起彼伏。

sentences.english: With mirth in funeral and with dirge in marriage.
sentences.chinese: 殯葬帶有歡樂而結婚奏唱悼歌。

sentences.english: Are playing a song, the blue sky behind the hidden secrets.
sentences.chinese: 皆奏一楓曲，蔚藍的天空背後暗藏的祕密。

sentences.english: Along with the music played, the two units together into a divorce ritual ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 伴隨着音樂的奏起，兩人攜手走進離婚儀式禮臺。

sentences.english: The first bell started to ring,and then the others chimed in.
sentences.chinese: 第一個鐘聲響起，其他鐘接着奏出和諧的樂聲。

sentences.english: Children luxuriate in the warm spring sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們盡情享受奏的溫暖陽光。

sentences.english: He ground out a tune on an organ .
This technique has worked for thousands of individuals for hundreds of years.
sentences.chinese: 千百年來，這項技能在成千上萬人身上奏了效。

sentences.english: You can rewind your lesson any time you want for a tune-up class.
sentences.chinese: 你可以倒帶你的教訓，任何時候你想要奏出行動階級。

sentences.english: Playing a bit of music on this piano will surely cheer you up.
sentences.chinese: 在這架鋼琴上奏點兒音樂會使你的心情愉快起來。

sentences.english: "We should do what only firemen can do, " said Lorenzo.
sentences.chinese: “我們應該做點只有消防員能做的事，”樓蘭奏說。

sentences.english: Clock period since meet, play flowing water with?
sentences.chinese: 鍾期既遇，奏流水以何慚？

definition: to submit a report to the king/to talk to the king
to present a memorial (to the Emperor)
to hand down an imperial edict
(of a court official) to present a memorial to the emperor (old)
to comfort/to console/to stroke/to caress/an old term for province or provincial governor
